txt.en: Ethring south entrance
'Not just Orcs in these mountains but cave trolls as well! I fear the worst is yet to come. Let us bring the fight to the Orcs instead of waiting here for them to attack Ethring.'
In Ethring's Defence
Defend the north-west entrance leading to Calembel
dnt
You hear a call to arms from Candúr
Speak with Arvaethor

'I wonder how long these Orcs have been waiting in the mountains so that they may once again prey upon the hard-working folk of the Vale.\n\n'Come, let us return to Ethring. This news of the Orc camp is worrying. We must help strengthen Ethring's defences before returning to the Orkish threat in the woods.'
The entrances of Ethring need defending!

'I am Laerind, wife of Arvaethor. My husband has returned and I am glad that he is safe. I thank you for aiding him.\n\n'Arvaethor should not worry of Ethring. In Borhador's reclusiveness, I have taken it upon myself to organize the village defences with what little resources we have. I have men upon the beacon of Eilendoth, on look-out for attacking Orcs. Our woodworkers have been tasked with making barricades and placing them at the town's four entrances.'
'Quickly, Orcs have been spotted around Ethring! We must protect the village. To arms!'
You have defended the north-east entrance of Ethring
Candúr can be found patrolling the village of Ethring.\n\nYou should speak with Candúr.
You have defended the west entrance of Ethring
Arvaethor has asked you to accompany him back to Ethring and help strengthen their defences.
Laerind can be found in the village of Ethring.\n\nYou should speak with Laerind.
Ethring north-west entrance
Defend the north-east entrance near the lumber mill
Defend the west entrance leading to Eilendoth
Defend the south entrance leading to Dor-en-Ernil
Defend the four entrances of Ethring.
Speak with Laerind
Speak with Candúr
Speak with Arvaethor.
You have defended the south entrance of Ethring
You have defended the north-west entrance of Ethring
